intro: Pulicaria phillipsiae, commonly known as the Canary Islands groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It is a low-growing perennial herb with yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has hairy, gray-green leaves and is adapted to arid and rocky environments. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and ragworts. Pulicaria phillipsiae is often found in coastal and mountainous regions, thriving in well-drained soils.
